headline: The Situation Room
subHeadline: Harris, Gov. Tim Walz (D-MN) Hold First Rally As Democratic Ticket; Harris Speaks After Picking Gov. Tim Walz (D-MN) As Running Mate; Gov. Tim Walz (D-MN) Gives First Speech As Part Of Democratic Ticket. Aired 6-7p ET

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Good evening. Good evening.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Good evening, everyone. Good evening. Good evening. Oh, it is good to be back in Pennsylvania.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So, let me say, on behalf of myself and the first second gentleman of the United States, my husband, Doug Emhoff --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- thank you for the warm welcome.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And let me just say, it's good to be here. All of the friends, all the leaders who are here. I want to thank former Governor Ed Rendell.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Senator Bob Casey, who we will re-elect this November.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Senator John Fetterman.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Mayor Cherelle Parker.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And Chairman Jaime Harrison. And it is so good to be here with your incredible governor, Josh Shapiro.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And I will say, Josh is a dear, dear friend, and an extraordinary leader. He and I have been spending a lot of time together over the years. And I told Josh, look, I am so, so invested in our friendship and doing this together, because together with Josh Shapiro, we will win Pennsylvania.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We will win Pennsylvania. And I thank you, Josh. I thank you.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So -- so, Philadelphia, I launched my campaign for the president of the United States a mere two weeks ago.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And it's been a bit of a whirlwind. And just last night the delegates to the Democratic National Convention finished voting and so --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: I stand -- I stand before you today to proudly announce I am now officially the Democratic nominee for president of the United States.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And so now we've got some work to do. We need to move to the general election and win that.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And to all the friends, listen, we also need to level set. We are the underdogs in this race. But we have the momentum, and I know exactly what we are up against.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Now, many of you know, before I was elected vice president or elected a United States senator, I was an elected attorney general and before that elected district attorney.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And before that, I was a courtroom prosecutor.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So, in those roles, I took on perpetrators of all kinds.(APPLAUSE) HARRIS: Predators who abused women. (BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Cheaters who broke the rules for their own gain.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So, hear me when I say --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- I know Donald Trump's type.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: Kamala! Kamala! Kamala!

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So, but -- but --

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: Kamala! Kamala! Kamala!

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Let me just say, let me say, hold on, hold on. Hold on. This campaign, our campaign, is not just a fight against Donald Trump. Our campaign, this campaign, is a fight for the future.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: It's a fight for the future. And, Pennsylvania, we fight for a future with affordable housing, affordable health care, affordable child care, paid leave.(APPLAUSE) (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We fight for a future where we build a broad-based economy, where every American has the opportunity to own a home, to start a business, and to build wealth.(APPLAUSE) (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We fight for a future where we bring down prices that are still too high, and lower the cost of living for America's families.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So that they have a chance not just to get by, but to get ahead.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We fight for a future where we defend our most fundamental freedoms, the freedom to vote --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- the freedom to be safe from gun violence.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: The freedom to love who you love openly and with pride.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And the freedom of a woman to make decisions about her own body. Not having her government tell her what to do.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So -- I love you, too -- so, here's the thing, here's the thing, since the day that I announced my candidacy, I set out to find a partner who can help build this brighter future.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: A leader who will help unite our nation and move us forward, a fighter for the middle-class, a patriot who believes, as I do, in the extraordinary promise of America.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: A promise, a promise of freedom, opportunity, and justice not just for some, but for all.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So, Pennsylvania, I'm here today because I found such a leader.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Governor Tim Walz of the great state of Minnesota!(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: To the people -- to the people of Southern Minnesota, for 12 years, he was congressman.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: To his former high school students, he was Mr. Walz.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And to his former high school football players, he was coach.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Coach. Coach.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And, in 91 days --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- the nation will know Coach Walz by another name -- vice president of the United States.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So, America, for some folks, they're just getting to know Coach Walz's story.And I will tell you, he is the proud product of a middle-class family in rural Nebraska. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: He is a veteran who served our nation in uniform for more than two decades as a member of the Army National Guard.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And he went to college on the G.I. Bill.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: He is someone who long before he entered politics worked as a teacher.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: When Coach Walz's and his wife, Gwen, moved from his native Nebraska to Minnesota nearly 30 years ago, they both took jobs at the local high school.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Coach Walz's taught social studies. Gwen taught English.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: After school, Tim was the linebackers coach for the football team --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- where I have heard the stories about he had a knack for using the game of football to teach life lessons. He saw the potential in kids who sometimes didn't even see it in themselves.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Under those Friday night lights, Coach Walz motivated his players to believe they could achieve anything. And, together, they defied the odds -- hear this now -- going from a winless record to the school's first ever state championship.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Coach. Coach.And I will say and I will add, Tim wasn't only a role model on the football field. Around that same time, Coach Walz was approached by a student in his social studies class. The young man was one of the first openly gay students at the school and was hoping to start a Gay- Straight Alliance. At a time -- at a time when acceptance was difficult to find for LGBTQ students, Tim knew the signal that it would send to have a football coach get involved. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So he signed up to be the group's faculty adviser.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: In the high school yearbook, the students voted Coach Walz the, quote, most inspiring faculty member.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And, as I think everyone here can see, Tim Walz was the kind of teacher and mentor that every child in America dreams of having --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- and that every kid deserves. The kind of coach, because he's the kind of person who makes people feel like they belong and then inspires them to dream big, and that's the kind of vice president he will be.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And that's the kind of vice president America deserves.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So it was Coach Walz's students who actually helped him decide to run for office, and he served 12 years in Congress, representing a purple district, as he reached across the aisle to get things done.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: He was the highest-ranking -- he was the highest-ranking enlisted man to ever serve in the United States Congress.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And the top Democrat on the Veterans Committee, and he was known as one of Capitol Hill's best marksmen, winning a bipartisan sharpshooting contest year after year.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: In Washington, Tim worked to raise the minimum wage --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- to protect the freedom of workers to join a union.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And he pass one of the critical votes to pass the Affordable Care Act --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- which of course gave health insurance to tens of millions of Americans.I'm going to tell you, when we win, Tim and I will continue to make the Affordable Care Act even stronger. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We will win.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Now, let's talk about what we're dealing with on the other side.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So on that last topic, if Donald Trump gets a chance, he will end the Affordable Care Act --(BOOING) HARRIS: and take us back to a time when insurance companies had the power to deny people with pre-existing conditions. Do you remember what that was like? Children with asthma, breast cancer survivors, grandparents with diabetes. Well Governor Walz and I will not let that happen. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Because we believe health care should be a right and not just a privilege for those who can afford it.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: As Governor, Tim has continued to fight for working families. He secured paid leave for workers in Minnesota.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And he refused -- he refused, as Governor, to allow any student in their public schools to go hungry.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And Tim Walz and I, we agree about many things, including when our middle class is strong, America is strong.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And strengthening the middle class will be my defining goal as I am president of the United States.(APPLAUSE) So, Pennsylvania, ours is a fight for the future of the middle class, and it is a fight for freedom. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: In this moment, we are witnessing a full on attack against hard-fought, hard-won freedoms and rights. Take reproductive freedom. Now, think about this. Donald Trump said he wants to punish women.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And as a result of his actions today in America, one out of three women live in a state with a Trump abortion ban -- one out of three.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Some of these bans go back to the 1800s. (BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Even before women had a right to vote. Think about that. Well, Tim and I have a message for Trump and others who want to turn back the clock on our fundamental freedoms -- we're not going back.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We're not going back. We're not going back. We're not going back.

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: We're not going back. We're not going back. We're not going back.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We're not going back.And so let me say about Tim Walz, he has shown up to stand against these attacks long before he stood on the stage with me. After Roe was overturned, he was the first governor in the country to sign a new law that enshrined reproductive freedom as a fundamental right. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And with Tim Walz by my side, when I am president of the United States and we win majorities in the United States Congress, we will pass a bill to restore reproductive freedom, and I will proudly sign it into law.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Tim Walz has also defended the sacred freedom to vote. As governor -- As governor, he signed the most significant expansion of voting rights in Minnesota in over 50 years.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And with Governor Walz's help, when I am president, we are going to finally pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act and the Freedom to Vote Act.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We're going to get it done.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So Tim is a hunter and a gun owner who believes, as the majority of gun owners do, that we need reasonable gun safety laws in America.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So as governor, he expanded background checks and increased penalties for illegal firearm sales.(APPLAUSE) HARRIS: And together, when we win in November, we are finally going to pass universal background checks, red flag laws, and an assault weapons ban. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: In fact -- in fact, when you compare his resume --(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Shall we? To Trump's running mate --(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- well, well, some might say it's like --(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: It's like a matchup between the varsity team and the J.V. squad.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So, Pennsylvania, ultimately in this election, we each face a question. What kind of country do we want to live in? A country, a country of freedom, compassion, and rule of law?(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Or a country of chaos, fear, and hate?(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And here is the beauty of our democracy. We each have the power to answer that question. We each have the power to answer that question. The power is with the people!(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: We love our country. And I believe it is the highest form of patriotism to fight for the ideals of our country.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: That -- that is how we preserve the promise of America. And after all, you know, the promise of America is what makes it possible for two middle-class kids, one a daughter of Oakland, California -- (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: -- who was raised by a working mother. The other, a son of the Nebraska plains who grew up working on a farm.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: It's the promise of America. Because only in America, only in America, is it possible for them together to make it all the way to the White House.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Only in America. Only in America.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Only in America.

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: USA! USA! USA!

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: That's right. That's right. And so Coach Walz and I may hail from different corners of our great country, but our values are the same. And we both believe in lifting people up, not knocking them down.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: He and I, we both know, the vast majority of people in our country have so much more in common than what separates them.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: When we look at folks, we see in our fellow Americans, neighbors, not enemies. Not enemies.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: So my promise to you is this. Our campaign will reach out to everyone, from red states to blue states.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: From the heartland to the coast, in rural, urban, suburban, and tribal communities.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And when elected, we will govern on behalf of all Americans.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And so, with Tim Walz by my side, and with all of you at our side, let us fight for the promise of our future.And with that, I ask Pennsylvania, are you ready to make your voices heard? (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: Do we believe in Freedom? Do we believe in opportunity? Do we believe in the promise of America? And are we ready to fight for it?(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: And when we fight, we win. And now, welcome the next vice president of the United States, Tim Walz.(APPLAUSE) GOV. TIM WALZ (D-MN), U.S. VICE PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE: Wow. (CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Wow. Thank you, Philadelphia.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Madam Vice President, for the trust you put in me, but maybe more so, thank you for bringing back the joy.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: I'm thrilled to be on this journey with you and Doug, this incredible journey. And Pennsylvania, I know you know this, but my God, what a treasure you have in Josh Shapiro.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Holy hell. Can this guy bring the fire? He can bring the fire. This is a visionary leader. Also, I have to tell you, everybody in America knows, when you need a bridge fixed, call that guy.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: And I think sometimes we forget and you see people a little one dimensional, but seeing a guy who cares so deeply about his family, a man with compassion, vision. And I'll have to tell you this, I know this from experience -- there is no one you would rather go to a Springsteen concert in Jersey with than him, than that guy.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: Bruce! Bruce! Bruce!

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Bruce.And I can't wait for all of you and America to get to know my incredible wife, Gwen, a 29-year public school educator. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Don't ever underestimate teachers.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: And our two beautiful kids, Hope and Gus. I couldn't be prouder to be on this ticket, and to help Vice President Harris become what we all know is very, very good for us to think about -- the next president of the United States of America.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: From her first day as a prosecutor, as a district attorney, attorney general of the great state of California, a United States senator and vice president of the United States --(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: -- Vice President Harris has fought on the side of the American people. She took on the predators. She took on the fraudsters. She took down the transnational gangs. She stood up against powerful corporate interests. And she never hesitated to reach across the aisle if it meant improving people's lives.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: I know a little something about that commitment to people. I was born in West Point, Nebraska. I lived in Butte, a small town of 400, where community was a way of life. Growing up, I spent the summers working on the family farm. My mom and dad taught us, show generosity towards your neighbors and work for a common good.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: My dad served in the Army during the Korean War. With his encouragement, at 17, I joined the Army National Guard.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: For 24 years, I proudly wore the uniform of this nation.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: The National Guard gave me purpose. It gave me the strength of a shared commitment to something greater than ourselves.And just as it did for my dad and millions of others, the G.I. Bill gave me a shot at a college education. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: My dad was a teacher. My brothers and sisters and I followed in their footsteps.Three out of four of us married teachers. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: What we do.For nearly 20 years, I had the privilege of teaching high school social studies and coaching football. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Including winning that state championship. Thank you.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Don't ever close the yearbook. Don't ever.But it was my students. They encouraged me to run for office. They saw in me what I was hoping to instill in them, a commitment of common good, a belief that one person can make a difference. So in 2006 -- 2006, I took a leap and I ran for Congress. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: And because high school teachers are super optimistic, I was running in a district that had one Democrat since 1892.Well, my neighbors graced me with an opportunity to represent them in the United States House of Representatives. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: I'm proud of the work we did there together. I worked across the aisle on veterans issues, on agriculture, and on ways to grow rural economies.I learned the art of compromise without compromising my values. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: And now as governor of the great state of Minnesota, I bring those experiences to bear in tackling the challenges that are facing our great state.Minnesota's strength comes from our values, our commitment to working together, to seeing past our differences, to always being willing to lend a helping hand. Those are the same values I learned on the family farm and tried to instill in my students. I took it to Congress and to the state capital. And now, Vice President Harris and I are running to take those very values to the White House. (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Now Donald Trump sees the world a little differently than us.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: First of all, he doesn't know the first thing about service.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: He doesn't have time for it because he's too busy serving himself.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Again and again and again, trump weakens our economy to strengthen his own hand.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: That's not even counting the crimes he committed.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: You know, some of us --

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: Lock him up! Lock him up! Lock him up!

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Some of us --

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: Lock him up! Lock him up! Lock him up!

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Some of us -- some of us in here are old enough to remember -- I see you down there. I see those old white guys.(LAUGHTER) (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Some of us are old enough to remember when it was Republicans who were talking about freedom. It turns out now what they meant was the government should be free to invade your doctor's office.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: In Minnesota, we respect our neighbors and their personal choices that they make.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Even if we wouldn't make the same choice for ourselves, there is a golden rule -- mind your own damn business.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: These guys are after my heart, chanting "mind your own damn business." That feels good, so thank you.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Look, that includes IVF. And this gets personal for me and my family. When my wife and I decided to have children, we spent years going through infertility treatments. And I remember praying every night for a call for good news. The pit in my stomach when the phone rang and the agony when we heard that the treatments hadn't worked. So it wasn't by chance that when we welcomed our daughter into the world, we named her Hope.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: When vice president and I talk about freedom, we mean the freedom to make your own health care decisions.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: And for our children to be free to go to school without worrying they'll be shot dead in their classrooms.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: By the way, as you heard, I was one of the best shots in Congress. But in Minnesota, we believe in the Second Amendment. But we also believe in commonsense gun violence laws.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Vice President Harris' idea of freedom is a ticket for education to be that ticket to the middle class. Not crippling debt, air that's clean, water that's pure, communities that are safe.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: A place where we settle our political differences not through violence, but with our votes. And that is what this election is about, what direction will this country go in?

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: We're not going back!

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: We're not going back. Well, Donald Trump would damn sure take us backwards, let's be clear about that.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: And don't believe him when he plays dumb. He knows exactly what Project 2025 will do to restrict our freedoms.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: To rig the economy to help the super-rich.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: If Trump gets the chance to return, he's going to pick up exactly where he left off four years ago. Only this time it will be much, much worse. Raising costs on the middle-class family. He will repeal the Affordable Care Act, no doubt about it.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: He'll will gut Social Security and Medicare.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump is not fighting for you or your family. He never -- he never sat at that kitchen table like the one I grew up at, wondering how we're going to pay the bills. He's at his country club up in Mar-a-Lago, wondering how he can cut taxes for his rich friends.And I've got to tell you, his running mate shares his dangerous and backward agenda for this country. (BOOING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: J.D. Vance literally, literally wrote the foreword for the architect of the Project 2025 agenda.(BOOING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Like all regular people I grew up with in the heartland, J.D. studied at Yale...(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: ...had his career funded by Silicon Valley billionaires, and then wrote a bestseller trashing that community. Come on! That's not what middle America is. And I've got to tell you, I can't wait to debate the guy.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: That is, if he's willing to get off the couch and show up, so.(LAUGHTER) (APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: You see what I did there? Look, I got to tell you, pointing out just an observation of mine that I made, I just have to say it. You know it, you feel it -- these guys are creepy, and yes, just weird as hell. That's what you see.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: That's what you see.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: So, you know what's out there. So, say it with me, we aren't going back.

utterances.speaker: AUDIENCE
utterances.sentences: We're going back! We are not going back! We are not going back!

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: So, we got 91 days. My God, that's easy. We'll sleep when we're dead.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Over those next 91 days and every day in the White House, I'll have Vice President Harris' back. Every single day.(APPLAUSE)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: And we'll have yours.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: You know how this works; we can't do it alone. We need you, each and every one of you.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: Go over to KamalaHarris.com, get on board, because we need you. Freedom to make our own choices. This leader, this compassionate, careful, joyous leader, believes in each and every one of you.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: My God, you came here tonight to sit (ph) at the very top because you love this country, and you're not going back.(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: WALZ
utterances.sentences: She believes in the opportunity for every single person to join the middle class. She believes in the promise of America. We just got to fight. We just got to fight. Because as soon-to-be President Harris says, when we fight, we win.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: We win!(CHEERING)

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Tim and Gwen Walz, Kamala Harris and Doug Emhoff, the Democratic residential and vice presidential ticket, and would-be first spouse and second spouse, and a packed arena here in north Philadelphia, the Liacouras Stadium.Vice President Harris, introducing her running mate, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, to an ebullient crowd here in Philadelphia. And he came out swinging against Donald Trump and J.D. Vance, calling them weird and creepy. Harris kicking off their first joint rally calling Walz a leader and a fighter who will help move the country forward. We have been watching it all from inside the arena at this landmark moment in this roller coaster of a ride on the way to the White House. Kasie Hunt, four weeks ago, who could have imagined that this was where we were going to be?

utterances.speaker: KASIE HUNT, CNN CHIEF NATIONAL AFFAIRS ANALYST
utterances.sentences: The voters were trying to tell us all along that something was going to happen. If the Biden Trump rematch could simply not be how this was going to go down in low and behold, they were right. And here we are today and I think you saw on display here why it was that Kamala Harris chose Tim Walz to be her running mate.He clearly -- the folksy charm was on display. You could really see how the crowd lit up, especially at his jabs at the Trump-Vance ticket. He and Harris both had to call him the crowd doubt a little bit when they started to chant "lock him up". Clearly, there were energized guys by the idea that Donald Trump is a convicted felon. Tim Walz went there and cracked a joke about the rumors that J.D. Vance inappropriately related to a couch, which I think caught a lot of eyes, raised a lot eyebrows, but in a campaign that's focused on Gen Z and trying to figure out how to break through a very difficult media environment, I think you saw why Walz is somebody that she chose. I also think you saw why it's Walz and not Shapiro. I mean, Shapiro clearly much more comfortable being number one. Walz seemed pretty comfortable being here as her number two in a way that seemed to lift her up, underscore the message she was making while not overshadowing her in any way. TAPPER: It's very interesting, Audie Cornish, right off the bat. Tim Walz, the governor of Minnesota, taking the opportunity to introduce himself to the American people by laying out his autobiography, including his wife and his fertility struggles, where they had a daughter, Hope, through IVF, which his counterpart, Republican Senator J.D. Vance has expressed issues about.

utterances.speaker: AUDIE CORNISH, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Well, I think one of the things that's interesting is Tim Walz is trying to connect with people. You don't have to be a woman to be interested in the issue of IVF. You don't have to be a woman to be interested in a variety of caregiving issues of the campaign is about and he's interesting because he tries to find a way to connect with people look and sound like him.I also want to bring up this idea we talked about Gen Z a lot. We maybe should think of it a little differently, like the Z is for zeitgeist, and this is a pair of people right now, this is a campaign that is seizing on culture, humor to make its voice. And usually can names leave that up to "SNL", right? They don't take that on themselves. He made jokes, right? He had energy, was just like a completely different vibe than a Joe Biden or the way a Kamala Harris had to perform next to Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Dana Bash, we are here in Philly at the Liacouras Stadium and I have to say and I'm told that they give these out or you can buy them at like Taylor Swift concerts. I'm sure you see them on the screen, these glowing, alternatingly red and blue bracelets that people are wearing.I know I sound 100 years old when I'm saying this, but I am. I am 100 years old. But let me just say, I've never been to a political rally where -- where they were giving out to people. So that the auditorium almost in as if it's planned --

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: They light up in unison, right?

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Sometimes, yes.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: And they don't have these at Dave Matthews concerts I'll say, but it's pretty interesting terms of how much this campaign as opposed to Biden-Harris, how much, Dana, Harris Walz is leaning into Gen Z culturally and you know, bracelet wise, also.

utterances.speaker: DANA BASH, CNN CHIEF POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Never mind the fact that Gen X was completely overlooked here.Jake, I -- my takeaway from your estimate, was that you and I have to go to a concert together because the last one I went to with was --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Presumably you --

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: -- with Coldplay and they had -- they had the bracelets. But let's -- let's stay focus on what we just saw there. Because I think your point is --

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: -- dying over here, guys.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Your point is --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure about the Coldplay, but okay. Yes, yeah. OK.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: OK. We're going to take that discussion offline. Look, what we just saw --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes. You could take me to Chumbawamba anytime you want, Dana. I appreciate it.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: What we just was there and you felt it, and you could feel it.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: -- concert on air. It's very strange.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Well, we just saw aside from the conversation about the random concerts that we are going to go to is what Jake just talked about, which is the unmistakable energy in that arena and that is an energy that the Democratic Party has been desperate for the sense of relief that there are grass roots voters and not even grassroots voters, just people who want to get out and participate, who feel energized to be able to do that and that was extremely clear in what we just saw in that arena in Philadelphia, there.And as we talked to our terrific panel here, I just want to say that listening to it, Kamala Harris and listening to the way that she prosecuted the case, so to speak, in ways that we've heard before but then seeing her in the sort of front position with somebody taking the back seat to her the way she has been, the position that she has been in for four years --

utterances.speaker: DAVID AXELROD, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: -- and having the woman in front which we have seen once before in 2016 when Hillary Clinton was the first woman to be at the top of the ticket was imagery and a sensibility that I think we should take a moment to talk about.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, well, listen, there's no doubt about it. You know, we were talking earlier among ourselves about ease with which Kamala Harris has kind of taken up this role. We remember her as a candidate in the past, less so. She seems very comfortable playing the lead role here.I'm struck by how comfortable Tim Walz seen in this role. You know, being name to a national ticket is a little bit like getting shot out of a cannon. You really don't know what you're getting into. I mean, this wasn't small town Minnesota here. He's stepped into a maelstrom and its going to be a maelstrom from here on. But this was a value-laden event. The energy was incredible. That is obvious, and I'm sure if Donald Trump is watching, he's got crowd envy right now, and a little bit of concern. But every speech and particularly Kamala Harris's speech and Tim Walz's speech was very much centered in economic, middle-class, economic issues.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: And that is -- that is where they need to be and the sense of picking Walz was reflected in that he doesn't bring a state, but he brings a state of mind.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: And he brings an experience --

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: And the kind of voter.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: -- and that is very, very palpable.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: And, Ashley, I was talking to somebody who knows Tim Walz well, who spoke to him along the lines of what Ax was just saying about being shot out of a cannon, saying as much as you can, stay true to yourself.

utterances.speaker: ASHLEY ALLISON, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Be yourself, and don't let the thin oxygen where you're going to be up in the stratosphere, get to you.

utterances.speaker: ALLISON
utterances.sentences: And I think that's what you're seeing and why people are resonating with it. There's an authenticity -- authenticity nature to it.To the bracelets that you got at the Renaissance tour or the Eras tour, that's the cultural reference, and Beyonce "Freedom" song that she walked out --

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Right.
